meanings.sent1: The visional test measured how well she could see.
meanings.sent2: Her visional abilities allowed her to spot the tiny details.
meanings.sent3: Wearing three pairs of glasses at once was a visional fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted a visional picture across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist's visional interpretation of the landscape was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The eagle's visional prowess helped it spot prey from high above.
meanings.sent2: His visional clarity was unmatched among his peers.
meanings.sent3: The detective's visional skills were so sharp, he could see clues others missed.
meanings.sent4: The old telescope provided a visional glimpse into the distant stars.
meanings.sent5: The glasses improved her visional acuity significantly.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the ability to imagine or foresee
meanings.sent1: Her visional dreams often came true in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent2: The author's visional storytelling captivated readers of all ages.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller's visional predictions were always intriguing.
meanings.sent4: His visional creativity led to groundbreaking inventions.
meanings.sent5: The child's visional playtime transported her to magical realms.

meanings.definition: A mental image or concept of the future
meanings.sent1: His visional of a successful career kept him motivated.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to create a shared visional for the project.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller claimed to have a visional of the upcoming events.
meanings.sent4: The artist sketched out his visional for the new mural.
meanings.sent5: The visional of a peaceful world inspired many to work towards harmony.
